---
title: "US Earnings Data (CPS MORG)"
---

## Overview

Current Population Survey (CPS) Merged Outgoing Rotation Groups data for analyzing earnings patterns, gender gaps, and returns to education in the US labor market.

**Used in:** Week 0 (Coding with AI)

**Source:** [Data Analysis Textbook Case Study](https://gabors-data-analysis.com/casestudies/#ch09a-estimating-gender-and-age-differences-in-earnings)

## Data Files

| File | Description |
|------|-------------|
| `morg-2014-emp-state5.csv` | CPS MORG 2014 data filtered to 5 states |
| `cpsx.pdf` | Codebook and variable documentation |

[Browse data files](data/)

## Code

| File | Description |
|------|-------------|
| `earnings.R` | R script for earnings analysis |

[Browse code files](code/)

## Key Variables

- `earnwke` - Weekly earnings
- `sex` - Gender
- `age` - Age
- `grade92` - Education level
- `weight` - Survey weight

## Learning Objectives

- Working with survey data
- Analyzing earnings distributions
- Creating visualizations with AI assistance
- Understanding gender wage gaps

## Sample Research Questions

- Is there a gender gap in earnings?
- How do earnings vary by education level?
- What is the age-earnings profile?
